data.title: Character Guide – The Aristocats
data.meta_description: Duchess - Madame Adelaide's cat and mother of three kittens Thomas O'Malley (full name: Abraham de Lacy Giuseppe Casey Thomas O'Malley) – A feral cat who befriends Duchess and her kittens, becoming a father figure to the kittens and falling in love with Duchess. Marie - middle kitten; often imperious or snobbish to her brothers,…
data.text:
Duchess – Madame Adelaide’s cat and mother of three kittens

Thomas O’Malley (full name: Abraham de Lacy Giuseppe Casey Thomas O’Malley) – A feral cat who befriends Duchess and her kittens, becoming a father figure to the kittens and falling in love with Duchess.

Marie – middle kitten; often imperious or snobbish to her brothers, but her mother’s especial companion.

Toulouse – the oldest kitten, who idolizes all alley-cats and especially Thomas. He is also a talented painter.

Dean Clark as Berlioz – the youngest kitten. He is somewhat timid and shy. He is also a talented pianist.

Edgar Balthazar – Madame Adelaide’s butler who tries to get rid of the cats in order to inherit her fortune.

Madame Adelaide Bonfamille – a former opera singer and owner of Duchess and her kittens.

Georges Hautecourt – Madame Bonfamille’s lawyer: an eccentric, lively old man

Scat Cat – Thomas’s best friend and leader of a gang of jazz-playing alley cats. Scat Cat plays the trumpet.

The gang of alley cats includes

Shun Gon – a Chinese cat, plays the piano and drums made out of pots.

Hit Cat – an English cat, plays acoustic guitar.

Peppo – an Italian cat, plays the accordion.

Billy Boss – a Russian cat, plays the double bass.

Roquefort – A house mouse and also a friend of the cats, who assists in the expulsion of Edgar.

Frou-Frou – Roquefort’s horse companion, who subdues Edgar.

Napoleon – a Bloodhound who attacks Edgar when he intrudes in the farm where Napoleon lives.

Lafayette – a Basset Hound and Napoleon’s companion. He sometimes proves smarter than Napoleon, but is also more timid.

Abigail Gabble – a goose who befriends the cats.

Amelia Gabble – Abigail’s twin sister.

Uncle Waldo – the drunken gander uncle of Abigail and Amelia.
